comments:
1. Enter '?Xms128M ?Xmx1024M' in ''default vm arguments' for any installed JRE in settings->java->Installed JREs. 
2. Enjoy full rebuild & clearing of all JRE settings

Moving to JDT Debug for comment

org.xml.sax.SAXParseException: Character conversion error: "Unconvertible UTF-8 character beginning with 0x96" (line number may be too low).

For some reason, the '-' minus character you have pasted in this bug report is the character \u2013. The character should be a standard minus \u002d. When I type the same thing into VM args, the problem does not occurr.

Reducing severity.
Looks like the "big" dash/minus comes from MS Word (I can copy and paste it from there as well and cause the problem).
Marking invalid - the wrong character was used for dash.

ok. thnx
